<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 243, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|>
0580/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 302, 905, 317]]<|/det|>
February/March 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[752, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 30 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 860, 620]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You may use tracing paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 218, 665]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 730, 698]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 70.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 621, 91]]<|/det|>
Point \(A\) has coordinates (6, 4) and point \(B\) has coordinates (2, 7).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 101, 351, 121]]<|/det|>
Write \(\overrightarrow{AB}\) as a column vector.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[751, 183, 881, 235]]<|/det|>
<form>\(\overrightarrow{AB} = \left( \begin{array}{c} \\ \\ \end{array} \right)\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 198, 920, 217]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 247, 94, 266]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 247, 569, 267]]<|/det|>
Find the interior angle of a regular polygon with 24 sides.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[641, 425, 928, 444]]<|/det|>
<form>.................................................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 457, 96, 476]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 453, 499, 477]]<|/det|>
Without using a calculator, work out \(\frac{15}{28} \div \frac{4}{7}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 486, 806, 507]]<|/det|>
You must show all your working and give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[641, 712, 925, 732]]<|/det|>
<form>............................................ [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 104, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 710, 89]]<|/det|>
The population of a town decreases exponentially at a rate of \(1.7\%\) per year.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 87, 364, 104]]<|/det|>
The population now is 250 000.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 477, 137]]<|/det|>
Calculate the population at the end of 5 years.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 500, 153]]<|/det|>
Give your answer correct to the nearest hundred.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 377, 920, 395]]<|/det|>
<form>.................................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 425, 104, 443]]<|/det|>
<label>13</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 424, 480, 442]]<|/det|>
Write the recurring decimal \(0.2\dot{6}\) as a fraction.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 440, 379, 458]]<|/det|>
You must show all your working.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 699, 920, 717]]<|/det|>
<form>.................................................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 104, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>18</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 374, 88]]<|/det|>
A car travels at a constant speed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 87, 574, 104]]<|/det|>
It travels a distance of \(146.2 \text{m}\), correct to 1 decimal place.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 517, 120]]<|/det|>
This takes 7 seconds, correct to the nearest second.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 510, 153]]<|/det|>
Calculate the upper bound for the speed of the car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[641, 295, 920, 313]]<|/det|>
<form>...................................... m/s [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 343, 104, 361]]<|/det|>
<label>19</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 635, 591, 654]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[581, 797, 920, 815]]<|/det|>
<form>x = ................... and \(x =\) ...................

\[x^{2} - 12x + a = (x + b)^{2}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 107, 416, 125]]<|/det|>
